xml:
STS-57 Mission: SPACEHAB-1; EURECA Retrieval Space Shuttle: Endeavour Launch Pad: 39B Launched: June 21, 1993, 9:07 a.m. EDT Landing Site: Kennedy Space Center, Florida Landing: July 1, 1993, 8:52 a.m. EDT Mission Duration: 9 days, 23 hours, 44 minutes, 54 seconds Orbit Altitude: 252 nautical miles Orbit Inclination: 28.45 degrees
STS-57 marked the first flight of the commercially-developed SPACEHAB, a pressurized laboratory designed to more than double pressurized workspace for crew-tended experiments. Altogether 22 experiments were flown, covering materials and life sciences, and wastewater recycling experiment for space station.
Crew consisted of Commander Ronald J. Grabe, Pilot Brian Duffy, Payload Commander G. David Low and Mission Specialists Nancy J. Sherlock, Peter J. Wisoff and Janice E. Voss.
